urlText: 05:55 Brisbane to Sydney XPT alteration
content:
NSW TrainLink advises from 23rd July Queensland has declared all of NSW a hotspot. NSW TrainLink XPT rail service will commence from Casino. Passengers travelling from Queensland locations will need to make their own travel arrangements to Tweed Heads in line with public health orders. At Tweeds Heads passengers can board the coach to Casino for the XPT train connection.
NSW TrainLink will resume trackwork coach services from Brisbane from Friday 17th November.

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Police Operation
content:
From 11:15am until 1pm buses will be diverting and missing stops while a Police Operation is underway and road closures are in place in the Sydney CBD on Sunday 12 December.
 
Services to Millers Point will end at St Mary's Cathedral, College St. No services will run from Millers St to the city. Stops between Hyde Park and Millers Point will be missed.
 
Services towards Central will pick up from William St opposite Australian Museum and end at Oxford St at Brisbane St. Continue on foot to Central Station.
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
Missed stops:
  • Argyle St at Watson Rd (stop ID 200098)
  • Hickson Rd opp Towns Pl (stop ID 2000179)
  • Hickson Rd opp Barangaroo South (stop ID 2000437)
  • Wynyard Station, York St, Stand G (stop ID 2000435)
  • QVB, York St, Stand A (stop ID 200041)
  • Town Hall Station, Park St, Stand G (stop ID 2000426)
  • Museum Station, Liverpool St, Stand G (stop ID 200072)
  • Museum Station, Downing Centre, Stand B (stop ID 200074)
  • Central Station, Eddy Ave, Stand D (stop ID 200054)
  • Central Station, Eddy Ave, Stand C (stop ID 200053)
  • Elizabeth St at Hay St (stop ID 200047)
  • Museum Station, Liverpool St, Stand A (stop ID 200071)
  • Museum Station, Elizabeth St, Stand D (stop ID 201055)
  • Australian Museum, William St (stop ID 201084)
  • Hyde Park, Park St, Stand C (stop ID 2000412)
  • Town Hall Station, Park St, Stand J (stop ID 2000425)
  • Kent St after Market St (stop ID 2000420)
  • Wynyard Station, Kent St, Stand V (stop ID 2000419)
  • Towns Pl after Hickson Rd (stop ID 2000154)
  • Argyle Pl at Lower Fort St (stop ID 2000100)
  •  Argyle St at Kent St (stop ID 200099)

urlText: Special Events - Sunday 12 December
content:
BBL: Sydney Thunder v Melbourne Stars - Sydney Showground Stadium, Sydney Olympic Park
19:15 to 22:15
- The closest station to the event is Olympic Park.
- Trains run from Lidcombe to Olympic Park every 10 minutes until late.

A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Sydney FC - Central Coast Stadium, Gosford
18:15 to 19:30
- The closest station to the venue is Gosford on the Central Coast & Newcastle Line. The stadium is a short walk from Gosford Station via Showground Road and Dane Drive.

For details, please visit https://transportnsw.info/events/2021/12

urlText: L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line partial closure due to Police Operation
content:
L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line light rail services will be impacted while a Police Operation is underway and road closures are in place in the Sydney CBD and Surry Hills.
 
Between 11.30am and 1.30pm approximately, light rail services will not run between Central Chalmers Street and Moore Park. Use alternative transport options or consider walking instead,
 
Catch regular route buses to travel between Central and Moore Park.
  • From Central: Route 339 towards Moore Park leaving from Albion St at Riley St
  • From Moore Park: Route 339 from Moore Park Busway at Lang Rd to Foveaux St at Crown St Central Station, Route 373 from Moore Park Busway at Lang Rd towards Hyde Park, or Route 396 from Sydney Girls High School, Anzac Pde towards Circular Quay
Walk via Devonshire St:
  • Between Central Chalmers Street and Moore Park: approx. 33 min.
  • Between Central Chalmers Street and Surry Hills: approx. 11 min.
  • Between Surry Hills and Moore Park: approx. 22 min
 
See the Moore Park walking route map to help find your way.
 
During this time, light Rail services will continue to run between Circular Quay and Central, and between Moore Park and Randwick or Juniors Kingsford.
 
Impact and times may change at the direction of NSW Police. Please check indicator screens, listen to announcements and follow the direction of staff and Police on site.

L1 Dulwich Hill Line replacement buses will continue to run as normal. See the news story for details on replacement buses.
subtitle: L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line partial closure due to Police Operation

From 10pm Sunday 12 December to 5am Monday 13 December 2021, construction work will result in bus stop Wynyard Station, Carrington St, Stand K (200033) being temporarily closed. Routes N90 and N92 to Town Hall will be affected, as will the N91 to Bondi Junction.
 
The alternative stop will be Wynyard Station, York St, Stand L (200034).

urlText: Station Update - Sydenham
content: Platforms 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works. A new Metro concourse is being constructed on the northern end of Sydenham Station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please ask staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info

urlText: Opal can be used between Wollongong and Moss Vale, Exeter and Bundanoon stations.
content:
If travelling by Coach between Wollongong station and Moss Vale, Exeter or Bundanoon stations you can use your Opal card or contactless card or device to tap on or off at your origin/destination station provided the origin/destination is an Opal enabled station.

If travelling onto Goulburn, or other Opal enabled station along the Southern Highlands Line, you should not tap off when transferring from Coach to an Intercity train but instead tap off at your destination station.

Booking is not required for Opal customers on this route.

urlText: Central Station: Access changes and upgrade works
content:
From 10pm Friday 17 December to 4am Monday 20 December 2021 the escalators and lifts between the Grand Concourse and Northern Concourse at Central Station will be closed for Sydney Metro construction works.

Alternative stairs, escalators and lift are available outside the Opal gates.

Please follow the signs and staff directions.

If you need assistance, see station staff.

 

From 21 November 2021 to March 2022, the north escalator from the concourse to Platforms 24 and 25 (Town Hall end) will be closed for maintenance works.

To access platforms 24 and 25 travel down the concourse to the lift or use the south escalator to Platforms 24 and 25 (Redfern end).

If you need assistance, see station staff.

 

From Friday 6 August 2021, the Southern Tunnel at Central Station will be temporarily closed for Sydney Metro construction works.

To access platforms 4 – 23 use the Suburban Tunnel or the Northern Concourse.
 

Platforms 16-23
Platform re-levelling and re-tiling works are being undertaken during rail shutdown weekends.

There will be changes to the floor surface in different areas of each platform, and there will be temporary concrete ramps that connect differences in floor levels.

Hoarding will also be adjusted on each platform to facilitate the progression of Sydney Metro construction works.

For your safety, please move carefully along the platform and follow directions from staff.

Change to boarding assistance location
Platform 16, 17
If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight, please board via the front door of the fifth train carriage.

Platform 18, 19
If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight, please board via the rear door of the fourth train carriage.

Platform 20, 21
If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight, please board via the front door of the fifth train carriage.

Platform 22, 23
If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight, please board via the rear door of the fourth train carriage.

Stair, escalator and lifts upgrade works from 11 January to end-December 2021
The escalators and staircase connecting the corner of Pitt Street and Eddy Avenue with the Grand Concourse and L1 light rail stop will be closed due to station upgrade works.

To access the Grand Concourse and Platforms 1 – 12 from the street level, please use the Western Forecourt entry via Pitt Street. To access Platforms 16 – 25 from the street level, please use the Eddy Avenue entry.

To access Pitt Street or Eddy Avenue from the Grand Concourse or L1 light rail stop, please exit the station via the Western Forecourt or Northern Concourse.

You can view a map of the station here.
subtitle: Central Station: Access changes and upgrade works

urlText: Allow extra time during Sail GP event
content:
F1 Manly ferries and F9 Watsons Bay ferries may experience delays while exclusion zones and speed limit reductions are in place around Shark Island on the harbour for SailGP Sydney practice and event race days at the following dates and times:
  • Thursday 16 December (practice racing) - exclusion zone from 12pm to 2pm
  • Friday 17 December and Saturday 18 December (race days) - exclusion zone from 3pm to 6pm, with racing from 4pm to 6pm
For more details on transport options and service changes, visit the SailGP Sydney event page.
subtitle: Allow extra time during Sail GP event

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Police Operation
content:
From 11:15am until 1pm buses will be diverting and missing stops while a Police Operation is underway and road closures are in place in the Sydney CBD on Sunday 12 December.
 
Services towards the City will be diverting via College St, Prince Alfred Rd, Macquarie St and Bent St. Services towards North Bondi will be diverting via Macquarie St, Prince Albert St, College St and Oxford St. Stops will be missed on Elizabeth St in both directions. Use alternate stops on Macquarie St.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
Missed stops:
  • Martin Place Station, Elizabeth St, Stand E (stop ID 2000283)
  • Hyde Park, Elizabeth St, Stand A (stop ID 2000167)
  • Museum Station, Liverpool St, Stand A (stop ID 200071)
  • Oxford St at Brisbane St (stop ID 201056)
  • Museum Station, Elizabeth St, Stand D (stop ID 200055)
  • St James Station, Elizabeth St, Stand C (stop ID 200057)
  • Martin Place Station, Elizabeth St, Stand C (stop ID 200421)
subtitle: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Police Operation

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Police Operation
content:
From 11:15am until 1pm buses will be diverting and missing stops while a Police Operation is underway and road closures are in place in the Sydney CBD on Sunday 12 December.
 
Services towards Bondi Junction will be diverting via Pitt St, Park St, Druitt St, Clarence St, King St, Elizabeth St, St James Rd, Prince Albert Rd and College St. Services towards Rozelle will be diverting via College St, Prince Albert Rd, Macquarie St, Hunter St, Castlereagh St, Hay St and Pitt St. Stops will be missed on Liverpool St and Elizabeth St in both directions. Use alternate stops on Castlereagh St, Pitt St or Oxford St.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
Stops missed:
  • Museum Station Liverpool St Stand G (stop ID 200072)
    • Alternate stop: Museum Station Castlereagh St Stand F (stop ID 200058)
  • Museum Station Downing Center Stand B (stop ID 200074)

urlText: 14:41 Sydney to Brisbane XPT alteration
content:
NSW TrainLink advises from 23rd July Queensland has declared all of NSW a hotspot. NSW TrainLink XPT rail service will terminate at Casino. At Casino, intending passengers can rebook to the Tweed Heads service to the border where they can make own arrangements for ongoing travel to Brisbane or Surfers Paradise, in line with public health orders.
NSW TrainLink will resume trackwork bus services to Brisbane from Thursday 16th December.

urlText: Buses replace light rail services on the L1 Line
content:
Buses replace all light rail services until further notice on the L1 Dulwich Hill Line between Central Grand Concourse and Dulwich Hill, due to light rail vehicle repairs.
 
From Monday 29 November, the following replacement bus routes will be operating:
  • Route 2L1 Central to The Star and return
  • Route 3L1 Lilyfield to Central via Glebe, The Star
  • Route 4L1 Dulwich Hill to The Star via Anzac Bridge and return
There will be an additional ferry service, F10 between Blackwattle Bay Wharf, Glebe and Barangaroo Wharf.
 
Please note:
  • A 50 percent discounted fare applies on board light rail replacement bus services.
  • The F10 service will only accept payments made with credit or debit cards, with full adult ferry fares charged.
  • All light rail replacement buses at Central Station depart from the Western Forecourt (adjacent to the Grand Concourse).
  • If you are travelling between Central Station and Darling Harbour, walking might be an alternative transport option.
  • L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line will continue to run as per normal schedule.
See here for further information on service frequency, recommended capacity and stop locations.
 
Allow extra travel time and use the Trip Planner or check travel alerts to see if you travel is affected, or to find alternative transport options.

urlText: Trains will run to a reduced frequency due to industrial action
content:
Due to planned industrial action, significant delays are expected on Sydney Trains and NSW TrainLink Intercity services. Trains will run to a reduced timetable and some services will be cancelled.
 
On Tuesday 14 December
  • Due to planned industrial action, trains will run to a reduced frequency throughout the day from first service until last service on the Sydney Trains and NSW TrainLink network. Overnight/early morning services will also be affected.
  • Trains will run every 30 minutes on some Sydney Trains suburban lines, and services will be stopping at all stations so customers should expect longer journey times.
  • Buses will replace trains on the T3 Bankstown Line between Bankstown and Lidcombe. T3 Bankstown Line services between Liverpool and the City will continue to run, however at a reduced frequency.
  • Buses will replace trains between Lidcombe and Olympic Park.
  • NSW TrainLink Intercity trains will run to a weekend timetable
  • Buses will replace South Coast Line trains between Port Kembla and Wollongong, Wollongong and Thirroul, and Wollongong and Kiama
For the latest information see the news story.

The 05:00 CLK164 Surfers Paradise to Casino coach service will commence at Tweed Heads. No travel will be provided between Surfers Paradise and Tweed Heads.

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Police Operation
content:
From 11:15am until 1pm buses will be diverting and missing stops while a Police Operation is underway and road closures are in place in the Sydney CBD on Sunday 12 December.
 
Services towards Bondi Junction will be diverting via King St, St James Rd and College St. Services towards Pyrmont will be diverting via College St, St James Rd, Macquarie St, Hunter St and Castlereagh St. Stops will be missed on Park St in both directions. Use alternate stops on Clarence St, Yurong St or at Town Hall Station.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
Stops missed:
  • Town Hall Station Park St Stand H (stop ID 2000249)
    • Alternate stop: Clarence St after Market St (stop ID 2000220)
  • Hyde Park Park St Stand B (stop ID 2000157)
    • Alternate stop: Yurong St after William St (stop ID 201070)
  • Hyde Park Park St Stand C (stop ID 2000412)
    • Alternate stop: Town Hall Station Parks St Stand J (stop ID 2000425)

urlText: The Crescent, Annandale temporary bus stop closure
content:
The westbound bus stop onThe Crescent at Johnston St(203816) will be closed from Monday 16 November 2020 until January 2023 for WestConnex Rozelle Interchange works.

Route 433 services towards Balmain Gladstone Park and Major Event Bus route 2 towards Sydney Olympic Park will use the stop on The Crescent at View St(203815) instead.

Check signs for directions to the alternative stop location.

urlText: 15:00 Surfers Paradise to Casino service alteration 19:11 Casino to Surfers Paradise service alteration
content:
Due to the Queensland lockdown, the 19:11 CLK173 Casino to Surfers Paradise service will terminate at Tweed Heads. No travel will be provided between Tweed Heads and Surfers Paradise.
The 15:00 CLK172 Surfers Paradise to Casino service will commence at Tweed Heads. No travel will be provided between Surfers Paradise and Tweed Heads. 
NSW TrainLink will resume bus services to and from Surfers Paradise from Friday 17th December.
subtitle: 15:00 Surfers Paradise to Casino service alteration 19:11 Casino to Surfers Paradise service alteration

urlText: Carrington St, Sydney, temporary bus stop closure
content:

Routes N90 and N92 to Town Hall will be affected, as will the N91 to Bondi Junction. The alternative stop will be Wynyard Station, York St, Stand L (200034).
